docs.text: Introduction Synopsys Polaris helps security and development teams analyze security risks in their software products. The Synopsys Polaris for Jenkins plugin enables you to invoke Synopsys Polaris analysis from your Jenkins builds. You can use Synopsys Polaris for Jenkins in both freestyle and pipeline jobs. When the Synopsys Polaris for Jenkins plugin runs, it checks the configured Synopsys Polaris server and the Jenkins node to see if the correct version of the Synopsys Polaris Command Line Interpreter (CLI) is already installed on the node. If it is not installed, the plugin installs the Synopsys Polaris CLI. In either case, Synopsys Polaris for Jenkins then executes the Synopsys Polaris CLI, which analyzes your project, and uploads results to Synopsys Polaris.
docs.title: Introduction

docs.text: Requirements The requirements for Synopsys Polaris for Jenkins are as follows: Access to the internet Jenkins version 2.60.1 or higher. Non-LTS versions of Jenkins are not supported. Java 8. Synopsys Polaris version 2020.03 or later, and a valid access token. The Synopsys Polaris CLI must run successfully from the command line on the project you are building, and the polaris.yml file must be included in the project source that is checked into the source code control system.

docs.text: Configuring Once the Synopsys Polaris for Jenkins plugin is installed, and before you use it in a job, you must configure the following: Synopsys Polaris CLI Synopsys Polaris for Jenkins Configuring Synopsys Polaris CLI Use the following process to configure Synopsys Polaris CLI: In Jenkins, navigate to Manage Jenkins Global Tool Configuration . Scroll down to the Polaris CLI section, click Add Polaris CLI , and complete the following: Name : A name for the Synopsys Polaris CLI installation. Install automatically : To enable Synopsys Polaris for Jenkins to install the Synopsys Polaris CLI from your Synopsys Polaris server automatically, leave this box checked, and proceed to the next step. To point Synopsys Polaris for Jenkins to an existing Synopsys Polaris CLI installation, uncheck this box and enter the path to the Synopsys Polaris CLI directory in the Installation directory field. Click Save . Configuring Synopsys Polaris for Jenkins Use the following process to configure Synopsys Polaris for Jenkins: Navigate to Manage Jenkins Configure System . Scroll down to the Synopsys Polaris section and complete the following: Polaris URL : The URL to your Synopsys Polaris instance. Polaris credentials : The Jenkins secret text credentials that you created to store your Synopsys Polaris access token. Advanced : If you want to change the timeout that Synopsys Polaris for Jenkins uses while waiting for a response from the Synopsys Polaris server, click Advanced and enter the timeout in seconds in the Polaris connection timeout field. Test connection to Polaris : To test that Synopsys Polaris for Jenkins can connect to Synopsys Polaris with the configuration data you have entered, click Test connection to Polaris . Click Save .

docs.text: Using in a build Freestyle build To use Synopsys Polaris for Jenkins in a freestyle build, add it as a Build Step at the point where you want to build your project, and complete the following: Polaris CLI Installation : Select the name you assigned to your Synopsys Polaris CLI installation on the Manage Jenkins Global Tool Configuration page. Polaris Arguments : The arguments you want passed to the Synopsys Polaris CLI (for example: analyze ). Wait for Issues : If you want the build to wait to see if Synopsys Polaris finds issues in your project, check this box and use the If there are issues field to select the action you want the plugin to take when issues are discovered. Click Advanced... if you want to adjust maximum length of time the job will wait for issues ( Job timeout in minutes ). If you want the build to proceed without waiting, leave the Wait for Issues box unchecked. Click Save . Pipeline build The Synopsys Polaris for Jenkins plugin provides two pipeline steps: polaris : Runs the Synopsys Polaris CLI to initiate Synopsys Polaris analysis of your project. polarisIssueCheck : Waits until Synopsys Polaris has completed analysis of your project, and determines the number of issues found. Documentation on using these pipeline steps can be found in the Jenkins pipeline steps documentation .
